VMware NSX for vSphere API documentation version 6.2.2

https://{nsxmanager}/api

vdsManage

This collection of methods are used to configure and prepare the VDS's for the use with NSX

/2.0/vdn/switches post get

post

prepares a pre-configured vds with teaming and MTU options, MTU must be 1600 or higher

get

Lists all vds's

post /2.0/vdn/switches

prepares a pre-configured vds with teaming and MTU options, MTU must be 1600 or higher

Secured by basic
  • Request

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<vdsContext>
    <switch>
        <objectId></objectId>
        <type>
            <typeName></typeName>
        </type>
        <name></name>
        <revision></revision>
        <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    </switch>
    <teaming></teaming>
    <mtu></mtu>
</vdsContext>

get /2.0/vdn/switches

Lists all vds's

Secured by basic

    /2.0/vdn/switches/datacenter/{datacenterID} get

    Lists all VDS's in a specified vSphere Datacenter Object

    get

    Lists all VDS's in a specified vSphere Datacenter Object

    get /2.0/vdn/switches/datacenter/{datacenterID}

    Lists all VDS's in a specified vSphere Datacenter Object

    Secured by basic
    • Request

    URI Parameters

    • datacenterID: required (string)

      A valid Datacenter Id (e.g. datacenter-4)

    /2.0/vdn/switches/{vdsId} get delete

    Retrieve a specific vds by specific switchId (e.g. dvs-26)

    get

    Retrieve a specific vds by specific switchId (e.g. dvs-26)

    delete

    Delete a specific vds by specific switchId (e.g. dvs-26)

    get /2.0/vdn/switches/{vdsId}

    Retrieve a specific vds by specific switchId (e.g. dvs-26)

    Secured by basic
    • Request

    URI Parameters

    • switchId: required (string)

      A valid switch (VDS) Id (e.g. dvs-26)

    delete /2.0/vdn/switches/{vdsId}

    Delete a specific vds by specific switchId (e.g. dvs-26)

    Secured by basic
    • Request

    URI Parameters

    • switchId: required (string)

      A valid switch (VDS) Id (e.g. dvs-26)

    vdnConfig

    Configurations of Segment ID's and Multicast Ranges for logical switches

    /2.0/vdn/config/segments post get

    Operations on Segment ID's (VXLAN Idd)

    post

    Add a segment ID Pool

    get

    Lists all Segment ID Pools

    post /2.0/vdn/config/segments

    Add a segment ID Pool

    Secured by basic
    • Request

    Body

    Type: application/xml

    Schema:

    <segmentRange>
    <name></name>
    <begin></begin>
    <end></end>
</segmentRange>

    get /2.0/vdn/config/segments

    Lists all Segment ID Pools

    Secured by basic

      /2.0/vdn/config/segments/{segmentPoolId} get put delete

      Operations on individual segment ID Pool

      get

      Retrieve details of an individual segment ID Pool

      put

      Update an individual segment ID Pool

      delete

      Delete an individual segment ID Pool

      get /2.0/vdn/config/segments/{segmentPoolId}

      Retrieve details of an individual segment ID Pool

      Secured by basic
      • Request

      URI Parameters

      • segmentPoolId: required (string)

        A valid segment Pool Id

      put /2.0/vdn/config/segments/{segmentPoolId}

      Update an individual segment ID Pool

      Secured by basic
      • Request

      URI Parameters

      • segmentPoolId: required (string)

        A valid segment Pool Id

      Body

      Type: application/xml

      Schema:

      <segmentRange>
	<end></end>
    <name></name>
</segmentRange>

      delete /2.0/vdn/config/segments/{segmentPoolId}

      Delete an individual segment ID Pool

      Secured by basic
      • Request

      URI Parameters

      • segmentPoolId: required (string)

        A valid segment Pool Id

      /2.0/vdn/config/multicasts post get

      Operations on multicast range Pools for logical switches

      post

      Adds a multicast range for logical switches

      get

      List all configured vdn Multicast Pools

      post /2.0/vdn/config/multicasts

      Adds a multicast range for logical switches

      Secured by basic
      • Request

      Body

      Type: application/xml

      Schema:

      <multicastRange>
    <name></name>
    <desc></desc>
    <begin></begin>
    <end></end>
</multicastRange>

      get /2.0/vdn/config/multicasts

      List all configured vdn Multicast Pools

      Secured by basic

        /2.0/vdn/config/multicasts/{multicastAddresssRangeId} get put delete

        Operations in individual multicast range Pools for logical switches

        get

        Retrieve details of an individual Multicast range Pool

        put

        Update an individual Multicast range Pool

        delete

        Delete an individual Multicast range Pool

        get /2.0/vdn/config/multicasts/{multicastAddresssRangeId}

        Retrieve details of an individual Multicast range Pool

        Secured by basic
        • Request

        URI Parameters

        • multicastAddresssRangeId: required (string)

          A valid multicast Pool range Id

        put /2.0/vdn/config/multicasts/{multicastAddresssRangeId}

        Update an individual Multicast range Pool

        Secured by basic
        • Request

        URI Parameters

        • multicastAddresssRangeId: required (string)

          A valid multicast Pool range Id

        Body

        Type: application/xml

        Schema:

        <multicastRange>
    <name>name</name>
    <desc>desc</desc>
    <end>239.3.3.3</end>
</multicastRange>

        delete /2.0/vdn/config/multicasts/{multicastAddresssRangeId}

        Delete an individual Multicast range Pool

        Secured by basic
        • Request

        URI Parameters

        • multicastAddresssRangeId: required (string)

          A valid multicast Pool range Id

        /2.0/vdn/config/vxlan/udp/port get

        View configured UDP port for VXLAN

        get

        View configured UDP port for VXLAN

        get /2.0/vdn/config/vxlan/udp/port

        View configured UDP port for VXLAN

        Secured by basic

          /2.0/vdn/config/vxlan/udp/port/{portNumber} put

          Updates the UDP Port used for VXLAN

          put

          Updates the UDP Port used for VXLAN

          put /2.0/vdn/config/vxlan/udp/port/{portNumber}

          Updates the UDP Port used for VXLAN

          Secured by basic
          • Request

          URI Parameters

          • portNumber: required (string)

            A valid UDP Port for VXLAN

          /2.0/vdn/config/resources/allocated get

          Query allocated resources

          get

          Retrieve a list of resources allocated

          get /2.0/vdn/config/resources/allocated

          Retrieve a list of resources allocated

          Secured by basic
          • Request

          Query Parameters

          • type: (string)

            set to "segmentId" or "multicastAddress"

          • pagesize: (string)

            Optional; limits the maximum number of entries returned. Valid range is 1-1024, default is 256

          • startindex: (string)

            Optional; specifies the starting point for retrieval. If not specified, resources are retrieved from the beginning

          vdnScopes

          Read all scopes (transport zones), or create a new scope (Transport Zone)

          /2.0/vdn/scopes get post

          get

          Retrieve a list of all known VDN Scopes

          post

          Create a new Transport Zone. Note that you can only add one initial cluster when creating the TZ.

          get /2.0/vdn/scopes

          Retrieve a list of all known VDN Scopes

          Secured by basic

            post /2.0/vdn/scopes

            Create a new Transport Zone. Note that you can only add one initial cluster when creating the TZ.

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            Body

            Type: application/xml

            Schema:

            <vdnScope>
    <name></name>
    <clusters>
        <cluster>
            <cluster>
                <objectId></objectId>
            </cluster>
        </cluster>
    </clusters>
    <controlPlaneMode></controlPlaneMode>
    <description></description>
</vdnScope>

            /2.0/vdn/scopes/{scopeId} get post delete

            Read, update and delete an existing scope (transport Zone)

            get

            Retrieve the properties of an existing network scope

            post

            Updates a transport zone, you can add a cluster to or delete a cluster from a transport zone

            delete

            delete a transport zone

            get /2.0/vdn/scopes/{scopeId}

            Retrieve the properties of an existing network scope

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            URI Parameters

            • scopeId: required (string)

              A valid scope Id

            post /2.0/vdn/scopes/{scopeId}

            Updates a transport zone, you can add a cluster to or delete a cluster from a transport zone

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            URI Parameters

            • scopeId: required (string)

              A valid scope Id

            Query Parameters

            • action: required (string)

              Mandatory queryParameter, use 'expand' to add a cluster, or 'shrink' to remove a cluster from the TZ

            Body

            Type: application/xml

            Schema:

            <vdnScope>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <clusters>
        <cluster>
            <cluster>
                <objectId></objectId>
            </cluster>
        </cluster>
    </clusters>
</vdnScope>

            delete /2.0/vdn/scopes/{scopeId}

            delete a transport zone

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            URI Parameters

            • scopeId: required (string)

              A valid scope Id

            /2.0/vdn/scopes/{scopeId}/attributes put

            update the attributes of a transport zone (e.g. Name, description)

            put

            update the attributes of a transport zone (e.g. Name, description)

            put /2.0/vdn/scopes/{scopeId}/attributes

            update the attributes of a transport zone (e.g. Name, description)

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            URI Parameters

            • scopeId: required (string)

              A valid scope Id

            Body

            Type: application/xml

            Schema:

            <vdnScope>
    <clusters>
        <cluster>
            <cluster>
                <objectId></objectId>
            </cluster>
        </cluster>
    </clusters>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <name></name>
    <description></description>
    <controlPlaneMode></controlPlaneMode>
</vdnScope>

            /2.0/vdn/scopes/{scopeId}/conn-check/multicast post

            Test multicast group connectivity in a transport zone

            post

            Test multicast group connectivity in a transport zone

            post /2.0/vdn/scopes/{scopeId}/conn-check/multicast

            Test multicast group connectivity in a transport zone

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            URI Parameters

            • scopeId: required (string)

              A valid scope Id

            Body

            Type: application/xml

            logicalSwitches

            Create and List operations of logical switches inside a Transport Zone (scope)

            /2.0/vdn/scopes/{scopeId}/virtualwires get post

            get

            Lists all logical Switches in the Transport Zone (Scope)

            post

            creates a logicalSwitch

            get /2.0/vdn/scopes/{scopeId}/virtualwires

            Lists all logical Switches in the Transport Zone (Scope)

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            URI Parameters

            • scopeId: required (string)

              A valid scope Id

            post /2.0/vdn/scopes/{scopeId}/virtualwires

            creates a logicalSwitch

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            URI Parameters

            • scopeId: required (string)

              A valid scope Id

            Body

            Type: application/xml

            Schema:

            <virtualWireCreateSpec>
    <name></name>
    <description></description>
    <tenantId></tenantId>
    <controlPlaneMode></controlPlaneMode>
</virtualWireCreateSpec>

            logicalSwitchesGlobal

            List Operations of logicalSwitches in all transport Zones (scope)

            /2.0/vdn/virtualwires get

            get

            List all logicalSwitches

            get /2.0/vdn/virtualwires

            List all logicalSwitches

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            Query Parameters

            • startIndex: (string)

              optional; specify starting point for retrieving logical switches

            • pageSize: (string - default: 20)

              optional; limit the max number of entries returned. Valid range is 1-1024

            /2.0/vdn/virtualwires/vm/vnic post

            Migrate a Virtual Maschine vnic to a logical switch

            post

            Migrate a Virtual Maschine vnic to a logical switch

            post /2.0/vdn/virtualwires/vm/vnic

            Migrate a Virtual Maschine vnic to a logical switch

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            Body

            Type: application/xml

            Schema:

            <com.vmware.vshield.vsm.inventory.dto.VnicDto>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <vnicUuid></vnicUuid>
    <portgroupId></portgroupId>
</com.vmware.vshield.vsm.inventory.dto.VnicDto>

            /2.0/vdn/virtualwires/{virtualWireID} get put delete

            Retrieves the configuration of an individual logical switch

            get

            Retrieves the configuration of an individual logical switch

            put

            Update a logical switch, possible updates are name changes & Controlplane Mode

            delete

            Delete a logical switch

            get /2.0/vdn/virtualwires/{virtualWireID}

            Retrieves the configuration of an individual logical switch

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            URI Parameters

            • virtualWireID: required (string)

              A logical switch id, e.g. virtualwire-1002

            put /2.0/vdn/virtualwires/{virtualWireID}

            Update a logical switch, possible updates are name changes & Controlplane Mode

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            URI Parameters

            • virtualWireID: required (string)

              A logical switch id, e.g. virtualwire-1002

            delete /2.0/vdn/virtualwires/{virtualWireID}

            Delete a logical switch

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            URI Parameters

            • virtualWireID: required (string)

              A logical switch id, e.g. virtualwire-1002

            /2.0/vdn/virtualwires/{virtualWireID}/conn-check/multicast post

            Test multicast group connectivity in logical switch

            post

            Test multicast group connectivity in logical switch

            post /2.0/vdn/virtualwires/{virtualWireID}/conn-check/multicast

            Test multicast group connectivity in logical switch

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            URI Parameters

            • virtualWireID: required (string)

              A logical switch id, e.g. virtualwire-1002

            Body

            Type: application/xml

            Schema:

            <testParameters>
    <gateway></gateway>
    <packetSizeMode></packetSizeMode>
    <packetSize></packetSize>
    <sourceHost>
        <hostId></hostId>
        <switchId></switchId>
        <vlanId></vlanId>
    </sourceHost>
    <destinationHost>
        <hostId></hostId>
        <switchId></switchId>
        <vlanId></vlanId>
    </destinationHost>
</testParameters>

            /2.0/vdn/virtualwires/{virtualWireID}/conn-check/p2p post

            Perform point to point connectivity test between two hosts across which a logical switch spans

            post

            Perform point to point connectivity test between two hosts across which a logical switch spans

            post /2.0/vdn/virtualwires/{virtualWireID}/conn-check/p2p

            Perform point to point connectivity test between two hosts across which a logical switch spans

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            URI Parameters

            • virtualWireID: required (string)

              A logical switch id, e.g. virtualwire-1002

            Body

            Type: application/xml

            Schema:

            <testParameters>
    <gateway></gateway>
    <packetSizeMode></packetSizeMode>
    <packetSize></packetSize>
    <sourceHost>
        <hostId></hostId>
        <switchId></switchId>
        <vlanId></vlanId>
    </sourceHost>
    <destinationHost>
        <hostId></hostId>
        <switchId></switchId>
        <vlanId></vlanId>
    </destinationHost>
</testParameters>

            arpMAC

            Working with ARP suppression and MAC learning for logical switches

            /2.0/xvs/networks/{ID}/features get put

            get

            Query ARP suppression and MAC learning information

            put

            Enable or disable ARP suppression and MAC learning

            get /2.0/xvs/networks/{ID}/features

            Query ARP suppression and MAC learning information

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            URI Parameters

            • ID: required (string)

              dvpg MoID or virtual wire ID

            put /2.0/xvs/networks/{ID}/features

            Enable or disable ARP suppression and MAC learning

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            URI Parameters

            • ID: required (string)

              dvpg MoID or virtual wire ID

            Body

            Type: application/xml

            Schema:

            <networkFeatureConfig>
    <ipDiscoveryConfig>
        <enabled></enabled>
    </ipDiscoveryConfig>
    <macLearningConfig>
        <enabled></enabled>
    </macLearningConfig>
</networkFeatureConfig>

            nsxControllers

            Working with NSX controllers

            /2.0/vdn/controller post get

            post

            Add a new controller on a specified cluster. Request without body to upgrade controller cluster

            get

            Retrieve details and runtime status for all controllers

            post /2.0/vdn/controller

            Add a new controller on a specified cluster. Request without body to upgrade controller cluster

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            Body

            Type: application/xml

            Schema:

            <controllerSpec>
    <name></name>
    <description></description>
    <ipPoolId></ipPoolId>
    <resourcePoolId></resourcePoolId>
    <hostId></hostId>
    <datastoreId></datastoreId>
    <deployType></deployType>
    <networkId></networkId>
    <password></password>
</controllerSpec>

            get /2.0/vdn/controller

            Retrieve details and runtime status for all controllers

            Secured by basic

              /2.0/vdn/controller/upgrade-available get

              Query controller upgrade availability

              get

              Query controller upgrade availability

              get /2.0/vdn/controller/upgrade-available

              Query controller upgrade availability

              Secured by basic

                /2.0/vdn/controller/progress/{jobId} get

                Status of controller creation or removal

                get

                Retrieve status of controller creation or removal. Returns percentage indication of job progress

                get /2.0/vdn/controller/progress/{jobId}

                Retrieve status of controller creation or removal. Returns percentage indication of job progress

                Secured by basic
                • Request

                URI Parameters

                • jobId: required (string)

                  Specified job Id

                /2.0/vdn/controller/{controllerId} delete

                Working with specified controller

                delete

                Delete NSX controller. When deleting last controller from cluster, forceRemoval must be set to true

                delete /2.0/vdn/controller/{controllerId}

                Delete NSX controller. When deleting last controller from cluster, forceRemoval must be set to true

                Secured by basic
                • Request

                URI Parameters

                • controllerId: required (string)

                  Specified controller

                Query Parameters

                • forceRemoval: required (boolean)

                  Force removal of controller (true/false)

                /2.0/vdn/controller/{controllerId}/techsupportlogs get

                Controller logs

                get

                Retrieve controller logs

                get /2.0/vdn/controller/{controllerId}/techsupportlogs

                Retrieve controller logs

                Secured by basic
                • Request

                URI Parameters

                • controllerId: required (string)

                  Specified controller

                /2.0/vdn/controller/{controllerId}/syslog post get delete

                Syslog exporter on controller node

                post

                Add controller syslog exporter on the controller

                get

                Retrieve details about the syslog exporter on the controller

                delete

                Delete the syslog exporter

                post /2.0/vdn/controller/{controllerId}/syslog

                Add controller syslog exporter on the controller

                Secured by basic
                • Request

                URI Parameters

                • controllerId: required (string)

                  Specified controller

                Body

                Type: application/xml

                Schema:

                <controllerSyslogServer>
    <syslogServer></syslogServer>
    <port></port>
    <protocol></protocol>
    <level></level>
</controllerSyslogServer>

                get /2.0/vdn/controller/{controllerId}/syslog

                Retrieve details about the syslog exporter on the controller

                Secured by basic
                • Request

                URI Parameters

                • controllerId: required (string)

                  Specified controller

                delete /2.0/vdn/controller/{controllerId}/syslog

                Delete the syslog exporter

                Secured by basic
                • Request

                URI Parameters

                • controllerId: required (string)

                  Specified controller

                /2.0/vdn/controller/{controllerId}/snapshot get

                Take a snapshot of the control cluster from the specified controller node

                get

                Take a snapshot of the control cluster from the specified controller node

                get /2.0/vdn/controller/{controllerId}/snapshot

                Take a snapshot of the control cluster from the specified controller node

                Secured by basic
                • Request

                URI Parameters

                • controllerId: required (string)

                  Specified controller

                /2.0/vdn/controller/cluster get put

                Cluster configuration

                get

                Retrieve cluster-wise configuration information for controller

                put

                Modify cluster configuration information for controller

                get /2.0/vdn/controller/cluster

                Retrieve cluster-wise configuration information for controller

                Secured by basic

                  put /2.0/vdn/controller/cluster

                  Modify cluster configuration information for controller

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  Body

                  Type: application/xml

                  Schema:

                  <controllerConfig>
    <sslEnabled></sslEnabled>
</controllerConfig>

                  /2.0/vdn/controller/credential put

                  Change the NSX controller password

                  put

                  Change the NSX controller password

                  put /2.0/vdn/controller/credential

                  Change the NSX controller password

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  Body

                  Type: application/xml

                  Schema:

                  nsxControllerPasswordUpdate

                  servicesScope

                  Working with services on a scope

                  /2.0/services/application/scope/{scopeId} get post

                  get

                  List services that have been created on the scope

                  post

                  Create a new service on the specified scope

                  get /2.0/services/application/scope/{scopeId}

                  List services that have been created on the scope

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • scopeId: required (string)

                    Can be globalroot-0 or datacenterId in upgrade use cases.

                  post /2.0/services/application/scope/{scopeId}

                  Create a new service on the specified scope

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • scopeId: required (string)

                    Can be globalroot-0 or datacenterId in upgrade use cases.

                  Body

                  Type: application/xml

                  Schema:

                  <application>
    <objectId/>
    <type>
        <typeName/>
    </type>
    <description>mandatory</description>
    <name>mandatory</name>
    <revision>0</revision>
    <objectTypeName/>
    <element>
        <applicationProtocol>mandatory</applicationProtocol>
        <value>mandatory</value>
    </element>
</application>

                  service

                  Working with a specified service

                  /2.0/services/application/{applicationId} get put delete

                  get

                  Retrieve details about the specified service

                  put

                  Modify the name, description, applicationProtocol, or port value of a service

                  delete

                  Delete the specified service

                  get /2.0/services/application/{applicationId}

                  Retrieve details about the specified service

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • applicationId: required (string)

                    Specified as returned by a servicesScope POST call

                  put /2.0/services/application/{applicationId}

                  Modify the name, description, applicationProtocol, or port value of a service

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • applicationId: required (string)

                    Specified as returned by a servicesScope POST call

                  Body

                  Type: application/xml

                  Schema:

                  <application>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <type>
        <typeName></typeName>
    </type>
    <description></description>
    <name></name>
    <revision></revision>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <element>
        <applicationProtocol></applicationProtocol>
        <value></value>
    </element>
</application>

                  delete /2.0/services/application/{applicationId}

                  Delete the specified service

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • applicationId: required (string)

                    Specified as returned by a servicesScope POST call

                  Query Parameters

                  • force: (boolean)

                    Indicates if the delete should be forced or unforced. The default is unforced (false)

                  applicationgroup

                  Operations on Application Groups

                  /2.0/services/applicationgroup/{scopeId} post get

                  Working with service groups

                  post

                  Create a new service group on the specified scope

                  get

                  Retrieve a list of service groups that have been created on the scope

                  post /2.0/services/applicationgroup/{scopeId}

                  Create a new service group on the specified scope

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • scopeId: required (string)

                    globalroot-0 or datacenterId in upgrade use cases

                  Body

                  Type: application/xml

                  Schema:

                  <applicationGroup>
    <description></description>
    <name></name>
    <revision></revision>
    <inheritanceAllowed></inheritanceAllowed>
</applicationGroup>

                  get /2.0/services/applicationgroup/{scopeId}

                  Retrieve a list of service groups that have been created on the scope

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • scopeId: required (string)

                    globalroot-0 or datacenterId in upgrade use cases

                  /2.0/services/applicationgroup/{applicationgroupId} get put delete

                  Working with an individual service group

                  get

                  Retrieve details about a service group

                  put

                  Modify the name, description, applicationProtocol, or port value of a service group

                  delete

                  Delete a service group from a scope

                  get /2.0/services/applicationgroup/{applicationgroupId}

                  Retrieve details about a service group

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • applicationgroupId: required (string)

                    Application group ID

                  put /2.0/services/applicationgroup/{applicationgroupId}

                  Modify the name, description, applicationProtocol, or port value of a service group

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • applicationgroupId: required (string)

                    Application group ID

                  Body

                  Type: application/xml

                  Schema:

                  <applicationGroup>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <type>
        <typeName></typeName>
    </type>
    <name></name>
    <description></description>
    <revision></revision>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <scope>
        <id></id>
        <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
        <name></name>
    </scope>
    <extendedAttributes/>
    <inheritanceAllowed></inheritanceAllowed>
    <member>
        <objectId></objectId>
        <type>
            <typeName></typeName>
        </type>
        <name></name>
        <revision></revision>
        <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
        <scope>
            <id></id>
            <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
            <name></name>
        </scope>
        <extendedAttributes/>
    </member>
</applicationGroup>

                  delete /2.0/services/applicationgroup/{applicationgroupId}

                  Delete a service group from a scope

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • applicationgroupId: required (string)

                    Application group ID

                  Query Parameters

                  • force: (boolean)

                    Indicates if the delete should be forced or unforced. The default is unforced (false)

                  /2.0/services/applicationgroup/{applicationgroupId}/members/{moref} put delete

                  Add or delete service group members

                  put

                  Add a member to the service group

                  delete

                  Delete a member from the service group

                  put /2.0/services/applicationgroup/{applicationgroupId}/members/{moref}

                  Add a member to the service group

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • applicationgroupId: required (string)

                    Application group ID

                  • moref: required (string)

                    Management object reference to the member

                  delete /2.0/services/applicationgroup/{applicationgroupId}/members/{moref}

                  Delete a member from the service group

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • applicationgroupId: required (string)

                    Application group ID

                  • moref: required (string)

                    Management object reference to the member

                  /2.0/services/applicationgroup/scope/{scopeId}/members get

                  Get the members of a service group

                  get

                  Get a list of member elements that can be added to the service groups created on a particular scope.

                  get /2.0/services/applicationgroup/scope/{scopeId}/members

                  Get a list of member elements that can be added to the service groups created on a particular scope.

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • scopeId: required (string)

                    globalroot-0 or datacenterId in upgrade use cases

                  ipPools

                  Create a pool of IP addresses

                  /2.0/services/ipam/pools/scope/{scopeId} get post

                  get

                  Read all IP Pools in a scope

                  post

                  Create a pool of IP addresses

                  get /2.0/services/ipam/pools/scope/{scopeId}

                  Read all IP Pools in a scope

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • scopeId: required (string)

                    globalroot-0 or datacenterId in upgrade use cases

                  post /2.0/services/ipam/pools/scope/{scopeId}

                  Create a pool of IP addresses

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • scopeId: required (string)

                    globalroot-0 or datacenterId in upgrade use cases

                  Body

                  Type: application/xml

                  Schema:

                  <ipamAddressPool>
    <name></name>
    <prefixLength></prefixLength>
    <gateway></gateway>
    <dnsSuffix></dnsSuffix>
    <dnsServer1></dnsServer1>
    <dnsServer2></dnsServer2>
    <ipRanges>
        <ipRangeDto>
            <startAddress></startAddress>
            <endAddress></endAddress>
        </ipRangeDto>
    </ipRanges>
</ipamAddressPool>

                  ipPool

                  Working with a specified IP pool

                  /2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId} get put delete

                  get

                  Retrieve details about the IP pool

                  put

                  Modify an IP pool

                  delete

                  Delete an IP pool

                  get /2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId}

                  Retrieve details about the IP pool

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • poolId: required (string)

                    Specified IP pool

                  put /2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId}

                  Modify an IP pool

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • poolId: required (string)

                    Specified IP pool

                  Body

                  Type: application/xml

                  Schema:

                  <ipamAddressPool>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
    <revision></revision>
    <type>
        <typeName></typeName>
    </type>
    <name></name>
    <extendedAttributes></extendedAttributes>
    <prefixLength></prefixLength>
    <gateway></gateway>
    <dnsSuffix></dnsSuffix>
    <dnsServer1></dnsServer1>
    <dnsServer2></dnsServer2>
    <ipRanges>
        <ipRangeDto>
            <id></id>
            <startAddress></startAddress>
            <endAddress></endAddress>
        </ipRangeDto>
    </ipRanges>
</ipamAddressPool>

                  delete /2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId}

                  Delete an IP pool

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • poolId: required (string)

                    Specified IP pool

                  /2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId}/ipaddresses get post

                  Work with IP's and their allocation status in IP Pools

                  get

                  Retrieve all IP's and their allocation status in an IP Pool

                  post

                  Allocate an IP Address from the pool. Use 'ALLOCATE' in the 'allocationMode' field in the body to allocate the next available ip. To allocate a specific one use 'RESERVE' and pass the IP to reserve in the 'ipAddress' fiels in the body

                  get /2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId}/ipaddresses

                  Retrieve all IP's and their allocation status in an IP Pool

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • poolId: required (string)

                    Specified IP pool

                  post /2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId}/ipaddresses

                  Allocate an IP Address from the pool. Use 'ALLOCATE' in the 'allocationMode' field in the body to allocate the next available ip. To allocate a specific one use 'RESERVE' and pass the IP to reserve in the 'ipAddress' fiels in the body

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • poolId: required (string)

                    Specified IP pool

                  Body

                  Type: application/xml

                  Schema:

                  <ipAddressRequest>
    <allocationMode></allocationMode>
    <ipAddress></ipAddress>
</ipAddressRequest>

                  /2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId}/ipaddresses/{ipAddress} delete

                  Release an IP Address allocation in the Pool

                  delete

                  Release an IP Address allocation in the Pool

                  delete /2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId}/ipaddresses/{ipAddress}

                  Release an IP Address allocation in the Pool

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • poolId: required (string)

                    Specified IP pool

                  • ipAddress: required (string)

                    The Id of the ip address to release, e.g. '192.168.10.10'

                  securityTag

                  • Request

                  Schema:

                  <securityTag>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <type>
        <typeName></typeName>
    </type>
    <name></name>
    <description></description>
    <extendedAttributes/>
</securityTag>

                  get /2.0/services/securitytags/tag

                      Specified security tag

                      Specified security tag

                      Specified security tag

                    • vmMoid: required (string)

                      ID of VM

                    ssoConfig

                    Operations on NSX Manager SSO registration

                    /2.0/services/ssoconfig get post delete

                    get

                    Query SSO Details

                    post

                    Register NSX Manager to SSO Services

                    delete

                    Deletes the NSX Manager SSO Configuration

                    get /2.0/services/ssoconfig

                    Query SSO Details

                    Secured by basic

                      post /2.0/services/ssoconfig

                      Register NSX Manager to SSO Services

                      Secured by basic
                      • Request

                      Body

                      Type: application/xml

                      Schema:

                      <ssoConfig>
    <ssoLookupServiceUrl></ssoLookupServiceUrl>
    <ssoAdminUsername></ssoAdminUsername>
    <ssoAdminUserpassword></ssoAdminUserpassword>
    <certificateThumbprint></certificateThumbprint>
</ssoConfig>

                      delete /2.0/services/ssoconfig

                      Deletes the NSX Manager SSO Configuration

                      Secured by basic

                        /2.0/services/ssoconfig/status get

                        Query the SSO configuration status of NSX Manager

                        get

                        Query the SSO configuration status of NSX Manager

                        get /2.0/services/ssoconfig/status

                        Query the SSO configuration status of NSX Manager

                        Secured by basic

                          userMgmt

                          User Management Operations

                          /2.0/services/usermgmt/user/{userId} get delete

                          Manage users

                          get

                          Get information about a user

                          delete

                          Remove the NSX role for a vCenter user

                          get /2.0/services/usermgmt/user/{userId}

                          Get information about a user

                          Secured by basic
                          • Request

                          URI Parameters

                          • userId: required (string)

                            user ID

                          delete /2.0/services/usermgmt/user/{userId}

                          Remove the NSX role for a vCenter user

                          Secured by basic
                          • Request

                          URI Parameters

                          • userId: required (string)

                            user ID

                          /2.0/services/usermgmt/role/{userId} get post put delete

                          Manage roles for users

                          get

                          Retrieve a user's role (possible roles are super_user, vshield_admin, enterprise_admin, security_admin, and audit)

                          post

                          Add role and resources for a user

                          put

                          Change a user's role

                          delete

                          Delete the role assignment for specified vCenter user. Once this role is deleted, the user is removed from NSX Manager. You cannot delete the role for a local user.

                          get /2.0/services/usermgmt/role/{userId}

                          Retrieve a user's role (possible roles are super_user, vshield_admin, enterprise_admin, security_admin, and audit)

                          Secured by basic
                          • Request

                          URI Parameters

                          • userId: required (string)

                            user to retrieve role information from

                          post /2.0/services/usermgmt/role/{userId}

                          Add role and resources for a user

                          Secured by basic
                          • Request

                          URI Parameters

                          • userId: required (string)

                            user to retrieve role information from

                          Query Parameters

                          • isGroup: required (boolean)

                            Set to "true" to apply to a group; set to "false" to apply to an individual user

                          Body

                          Type: application/xml

                          Schema:

                          <accessControlEntry>
    <role></role>
    <resource>
        <resourceId></resourceId>
    </resource>
</accessControlEntry>

                          put /2.0/services/usermgmt/role/{userId}

                          Change a user's role

                          Secured by basic
                          • Request

                          URI Parameters

                          • userId: required (string)

                            user to retrieve role information from

                          Body

                          Type: application/xml

                          Schema:

                          <accessControlEntry>
    <role></role>
    <resource>
        <resourceId></resourceId>
    </resource>
</accessControlEntry>

                          delete /2.0/services/usermgmt/role/{userId}

                          Delete the role assignment for specified vCenter user. Once this role is deleted, the user is removed from NSX Manager. You cannot delete the role for a local user.

                          Secured by basic
                          • Request

                          URI Parameters

                          • userId: required (string)

                            user to retrieve role information from

                          /2.0/services/usermgmt/enablestate/{value} put

                          Change the state of a user account (enabled/disabled)

                          put

                          Enable or disable a user account

                          put /2.0/services/usermgmt/enablestate/{value}

                          Enable or disable a user account

                          Secured by basic
                          • Request

                          URI Parameters

                          • value: required (integer)

                            value can be 0 to disable, or 1 to enable

                          /2.0/services/usermgmt/users/vsm get

                          Get information about users who have been assigned a NSX Manager role (local users as well as vCenter users with NSX Manager role)

                          get

                          Get information about users who have been assigned a NSX Manager role (local users as well as vCenter users with NSX Manager role)

                          get /2.0/services/usermgmt/users/vsm

                          Get information about users who have been assigned a NSX Manager role (local users as well as vCenter users with NSX Manager role)

                          Secured by basic

                            /2.0/services/usermgmt/roles get

                            NSX Manager user management operations on roles

                            get

                            Read all possible roles in NSX Manager

                            get /2.0/services/usermgmt/roles

                            Read all possible roles in NSX Manager

                            Secured by basic

                              /2.0/services/usermgmt/scopingobjects get

                              Retrieve a list of objects that can be used to define a user's access scope

                              get

                              Retrieve a list of objects that can be used to define a user's access scope

                              get /2.0/services/usermgmt/scopingobjects

                                secGroup

                                Operations on securitygroups

                                /2.0/services/securitygroup/bulk/{scopeId} post

                                Create a new security group on a global scope

                                post

                                Create a new security group on a global scope

                                post /2.0/services/securitygroup/bulk/{scopeId}

                                Create a new security group on a global scope

                                Secured by basic
                                • Request

                                URI Parameters

                                • scopeId: required (string)

                                  In the current version the scopeId will always be globalroot-0

                                Body

                                Type: application/xml

                                Schema:

                                <securitygroup>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
    <revision></revision>
    <type>
        <typeName></typeName>
    </type>
    <name></name>
    <scope>
        <id></id>
        <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
        <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
        <name></name>
        <revision></revision>
    </scope>
    <clientHandle></clientHandle>
    <extendedAttributes/>
    <member>
        <objectId></objectId>
        <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
        <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
        <revision></revision>
        <type>
            <typeName></typeName>
        </type>
        <name></name>
        <scope>
            <id></id>
            <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
            <name></name>
        </scope>
        <clientHandle></clientHandle>
        <extendedAttributes/>
    </member>
    <excludeMember>
        <objectId></objectId>
        <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
        <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
        <revision></revision>
        <type>
            <typeName></typeName>
        </type>
        <name></name>
        <scope>
            <id></id>
            <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
            <name></name>
        </scope>
        <clientHandle></clientHandle>
        <extendedAttributes/>
    </excludeMember>
    <dynamicMemberDefinition>
        <dynamicSet>
            <operator></operator>
            <dynamicCriteria>
                <operator></operator>
                <key></key>
                <criteria></criteria>
                <value></value>
            </dynamicCriteria>
        </dynamicSet>
    </dynamicMemberDefinition>
</securitygroup>

                                /2.0/services/securitygroup/bulk/{objectId} put

                                Update a specific security group

    </type>
    <name></name>

        <id></id>
        <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>

    </scope>

    <extendedAttributes/>
    <member>
        <objectId></objectId>
        <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
        <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
        <revision></revision>
        <type>
            <typeName></typeName>
        </type>
        <name></name>
        <scope>

            <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
            <name></name>
        </scope>

        <objectId></objectId>
        <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>

        <type>
            <typeName></typeName>
        </type>
        <name></name>
        <scope>
            <id></id>
            <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
            <name></name>
        </scope>
        <clientHandle></clientHandle>
        <extendedAttributes/>
    </excludeMember>

            </dynamicCriteria>

                                /2.0/services/securitygroup/internal/scope/{scopeId} get

                                Information on internal security groups

                                get

                                Retrieve all internal security groups on the NSX Manager. These are used internally by the system and should not be created or modified by end users.

                                get /2.0/services/securitygroup/internal/scope/{scopeId}

                                Retrieve all internal security groups on the NSX Manager. These are used internally by the system and should not be created or modified by end users.

                                Secured by basic
                                • Request

                                URI Parameters

                                • scopeId: required (string)

                                  Specified transport zone (scope)

                                ipset

                                Operations on IP Sets

                                /2.0/services/ipset/scope/{scopeMoref} get

                                get

                                Retrieve all configured IPSets

                                get /2.0/services/ipset/scope/{scopeMoref}

                                Retrieve all configured IPSets

                                Secured by basic
                                • Request

                                URI Parameters

                                • ipsetScopeMoref: required (string)

                                  In the current version this scope-ref will always be globalroot-0

                                /2.0/services/ipset/{scopeMoref} post

                                post

                                creates a new IPset

                                post /2.0/services/ipset/{scopeMoref}

                                creates a new IPset

                                Secured by basic
                                • Request

                                URI Parameters

                                • ipsetScopeMoref: required (string)

                                  In the current version this scope-ref will always be globalroot-0

                                Body

                                Type: application/xml

                                Schema:

                                <ipset>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <type>
        <typeName></typeName>
    </type>
    <description></description>
    <name></name>
    <revision></revision>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <value></value>
    <inheritanceAllowed></inheritanceAllowed>
</ipset>

                                /2.0/services/ipset/{ipsetId} get put delete

                                get

                                Retrieve an individual IPset

                                put

                                Modify an existing IPset

                                delete

                                delete an IPset

                                get /2.0/services/ipset/{ipsetId}

                                Retrieve an individual IPset

                                Secured by basic
                                • Request

                                URI Parameters

                                • ipsetId: required (string)

                                  The IPset to be queried or changed

                                put /2.0/services/ipset/{ipsetId}

                                Modify an existing IPset

                                Secured by basic
                                • Request

                                URI Parameters

                                • ipsetId: required (string)

                                  The IPset to be queried or changed

                                delete /2.0/services/ipset/{ipsetId}

                                delete an IPset

                                Secured by basic
                                • Request

                                URI Parameters

                                • ipsetId: required (string)

                                  The IPset to be queried or changed

                                vCenterConfig

                                Configuring NSX Manager with vCenter Server

                                /2.0/services/vcconfig get put

                                get

                                Get vCenter Server configuration details on NSX Manager

                                put

                                Synchronize NSX Manager with vCenter server

                                get /2.0/services/vcconfig

                                Get vCenter Server configuration details on NSX Manager

                                Secured by basic

                                  put /2.0/services/vcconfig

                                  Synchronize NSX Manager with vCenter server

                                  Secured by basic
                                  • Request

                                  Body

                                  Type: application/xml

                                  Schema:

                                  <vcInfo>
    <ipAddress></ipAddress>
    <userName></userName>
    <password></password>
    <certificateThumbprint></certificateThumbprint>
    <assignRoleToUser></assignRoleToUser>
    <pluginDownloadServer></pluginDownloadServer>
    <pluginDownloadPort></pluginDownloadPort>
</vcInfo>

                                  /2.0/services/vcconfig/status get

                                  Connection status for vCenter Server

                                  get

                                  Get default vCenter Server connection status

                                  get /2.0/services/vcconfig/status

                                  Get default vCenter Server connection status

                                  Secured by basic

                                    universalSync

                                    Configuring Universal Sync for the NSX manager

                                    /2.0/universalsync/configuration/role post get

                                    Universal Sync Configuration

                                    post

                                    Set the Universal Sync Configuration role

                                    get

                                    Get the Universal Sync Configuration role

                                    post /2.0/universalsync/configuration/role

                                    Set the Universal Sync Configuration role

                                    Secured by basic
                                    • Request

                                    Query Parameters

                                    • action: (string)

                                      Set the role of the NSX manager. Possible values are set-as-standalone, set-as-primary, set-as-secondary

                                    get /2.0/universalsync/configuration/role

                                    Get the Universal Sync Configuration role

                                    Secured by basic

                                      delete

                                      Delete secondary NSX manager configuration

                                      Delete secondary NSX manager configuration

                                      Secured by basic

                                        /2.0/universalsync/configuration/nsxmanagers/thumbprint put

                                        Universal sync configuration NSX manager thumbprint

                                        put

                                        Update the NSX manager thumprint in the universal sync configuration

                                        Secured by basic
                                        • Request

                                        Body

    <uuid></uuid>

   <isPrimary></isPrimary>
</nsxManagerInfo>

                                        Universal sync configuration of a specific NSX manager

                                        get

                                        Query universal sync configuration information on a specific NSX manager by ID

                                        delete

                                        Delete a secondary NSX manager by ID

                                        get /2.0/universalsync/configuration/nsxmanagers/thumbprint/{nsxManagerID}

                                        Query universal sync configuration information on a specific NSX manager by ID

                                        Secured by basic
                                        • Request

                                        URI Parameters

                                        • nsxManagerID: required (string)

                                        delete /2.0/universalsync/configuration/nsxmanagers/thumbprint/{nsxManagerID}

                                        Delete a secondary NSX manager by ID

                                        Secured by basic
                                        • Request

                                        URI Parameters

                                        • nsxManagerID: required (string)

                                        Query Parameters

                                        • universalSyncConfigurationManagerDeleteforceRemoval: (boolean)

                                          Force removal of a secondary NSX manager (true/false)

                                        /2.0/universalsync/sync post

                                        Sync all objects on the NSX manager

                                        post

                                        Sync all objects on the NSX manager

                                        post /2.0/universalsync/sync

                                        Sync all objects on the NSX manager

                                        Secured by basic
                                        • Request

                                        Query Parameters

                                        • application: (string)

                                          Use "invoke" to sync all objects on the NSX manager

                                        /2.0/universalsync/entitystatus get

                                        The status of an universal sync entity

                                        get

                                        Read the status of a universal sync entity

                                        get /2.0/universalsync/entitystatus

                                        Read the status of a universal sync entity

                                        Secured by basic
                                        • Request

                                        Query Parameters

                                        • objectType: (string)

                                          Specifiy the object type. For example "VdnScope"

                                        • objectId: (string)

                                          Specify the bojectID. For example "globalvdnscope"

                                                                          /1.0/appliance-management/backuprestore/backupsettings get put delete

                                                                          Appliance Manager backup settings

                                                                          get

                                                                          Retrieve backup settings

                                                                          put

                                                                          Configure backup on the Appliance Manager

                                                                          delete

                                                                          Delete Appliance Manager backup configuration

                                                                          get /1.0/appliance-management/backuprestore/backupsettings

                                                                          Retrieve backup settings

                                                                          Secured by basic

                                                                            put /1.0/appliance-management/backuprestore/backupsettings

                                                                            Configure backup on the Appliance Manager

                                                                            Secured by basic
                                                                            • Request

                                                                            Body

                                                                            Type: application/xml

                                                                            Schema:

                                                                            <backupRestoreSettings>
    <ftpSettings>
        <transferProtocol></transferProtocol>
        <hostNameIPAddress></hostNameIPAddress>
        <port></port>
        <userName></userName>
        <password></password>
        <backupDirectory></backupDirectory>
        <filenamePrefix></filenamePrefix>
        <passiveMode></passiveMode>
        <useEPRT></useEPRT>
        <useEPSV></useEPSV>
    </ftpSettings>
    <backupFrequency>
        <frequency></frequency>
        <dayOfWeek></dayOfWeek>
        <hourOfDay></hourOfDay>
        <minuteOfHour></minuteOfHour>
    </backupFrequency>
    <excludeTables>
        <excludeTable></excludeTable>
    </excludeTables>
</backupRestoreSettings>

                                                                            delete /1.0/appliance-management/backuprestore/backupsettings

                                                                            Delete Appliance Manager backup configuration

                                                                            Secured by basic

                                                                              /1.0/appliance-management/backuprestore/backup post

                                                                                        systemEvents

                                                                                        Get NSX Manager system events

                                                                                        /2.0/systemevent get

                                                                                        get

                                                                                        Get NSX Manager system events

                                                                                        get /2.0/systemevent

                                                                                        Get NSX Manager system events

                                                                                        Secured by basic
                                                                                        • Request

                                                                                        Query Parameters

                                                                                        • startIndex: (string)

                                                                                          optional; specify starting point for retrieving the logs

                                                                                        • pageSize: (string - default: 256)

                                                                                          optional; limit the max number of entries returned. Valid range is 1-1024

                                                                                        auditLogs

                                                                                        Get NSX Manager audit logs

                                                                                        /2.0/auditlog get

                                                                                        get

                                                                                        Get NSX Manager audit logs

                                                                                        get /2.0/auditlog

                                                                                        Get NSX Manager audit logs

                                                                                        Secured by basic
                                                                                        • Request

                                                                                        Query Parameters

                                                                                        • startIndex: (string)

                                                                                          optional; specify starting point for retrieving the logs

                                                                                        • pageSize: (string - default: 256)

                                                                                          optional; limit the max number of entries returned. Valid range is 1-1024

                                                                                        nwfabric

                                                                                        Network virtualization components

                                                                                        /2.0/nwfabric/configure post put delete

                                                                                        Install components

                                                                                        post

                                                                                        Install network virtualization components

                                                                                        put

                                                                                        Upgrade network virtualization components

                                                                                        delete

                                                                                        Delete network virtualization components

                                                                                        post /2.0/nwfabric/configure

                                                                                        Install network virtualization components

                                                                                        Secured by basic
                                                                                        • Request

                                                                                        Query Parameters

                                                                                        • action: (string)

                                                                                          If used, set to "synchronize" to reset communication between NSX Manager and a host/cluster

                                                                                        Body

                                                                                        Type: application/xml

                                                                                        Schema:

                                                                                        <nwFabricFeatureConfig>
    <featureId></featureId>
    <resourceConfig>
        <resourceId></resourceId>
    </resourceConfig>
</nwFabricFeatureConfig>

                                                                                        Example:

                                                                                        Prepare a cluster (install VIBs) =>
<nwFabricFeatureConfig>
  <resourceConfig>
    <resourceId>domain-c26</resourceId>
  </resourceConfig>
</nwFabricFeatureConfig>

VXLAN Context Configuration =>
<nwFabricFeatureConfig>
  <featureId>com.vmware.vshield.vsm.vxlan</featureId>
  <resourceConfig>
    <resourceId>dvs-34</resourceId>
    <configSpec class="vdsContext">
      <switch>
        <objectId>dvs-34</objectId>
      </switch>
      <teaming>FAILOVER_ORDER</teaming>
      <mtu>1600</mtu>
    </configSpec>
  </resourceConfig>
</nwFabricFeatureConfig>

VXLAN Cluster Prep =>
<nwFabricFeatureConfig>
  <featureId>com.vmware.vshield.vsm.vxlan</featureId>
  <resourceConfig>
    <resourceId>domain-c26</resourceId>
    <configSpec class="clusterMappingSpec">
      <switch>
        <objectId>dvs-34</objectId>
      </switch>
      <ipPoolId>ipaddresspool-3</ipPoolId>
      <vlanId>100</vlanId>
      <vmknicCount>1</vmknicCount>
    </configSpec>
  </resourceConfig>
</nwFabricFeatureConfig>

                                                                                        put /2.0/nwfabric/configure

                                                                                        Upgrade network virtualization components

                                                                                        Secured by basic
                                                                                        • Request

                                                                                        Body

                                                                                        Type: application/xml

                                                                                        Schema:

                                                                                        <nwFabricFeatureConfig>
    <featureId></featureId>
    <resourceConfig>
        <resourceId></resourceId>
    </resourceConfig>
</nwFabricFeatureConfig>

                                                                                        delete /2.0/nwfabric/configure

                                                                                        Delete network virtualization components

                                                                                        Secured by basic
                                                                                        • Request

                                                                                        Body

                                                                                        Type: application/xml

                                                                                        Schema:

                                                                                        <nwFabricFeatureConfig>
    <featureId></featureId>
    <resourceConfig>
        <resourceId></resourceId>
    </resourceConfig>
</nwFabricFeatureConfig>

                                                                                        /2.0/nwfabric/features get

                                                                                        get

                                                                                        Retrieves all features available on the cluster

                                                                                        get /2.0/nwfabric/features

                                                                                        Retrieves all features available on the cluster

                                                                                        Secured by basic

                                                                                          /2.0/nwfabric/status get

                                                                                          get

                                                                                          Retrieves the Status of Resources

                                                                                          get /2.0/nwfabric/status

                                                                                          Retrieves the Status of Resources

                                                                                          Secured by basic
                                                                                          • Request

                                                                                          Query Parameters

                                                                                          • resource: required (string)

                                                                                            This is a valid vCenter MOID, e.g. domain-c34 for a cluster

                                                                                          /2.0/nwfabric/status/child/{parentResourceID} get

                                                                                          get

                                                                                          Retrieve status

                                                                                          • Request

                                                                                            Parent resource ID

                                                                                          get

                                                                                          get /2.0/nwfabric/status/alleligible/{resourceType}

                                                                                          Query status of resources by criterion

                                                                                          Secured by basic
                                                                                          • Request

                                                                                          URI Parameters

                                                                                          • resourceType: required (string)

                                                                                            Valid resource type

                                                                                          /2.0/nwfabric/clusters/{clusterID} get put delete

                                                                                          put

                                                                                          delete
